medical_history.chief_complaint: Heart failure symptoms caused by severe recurrent aortic regurgitation (AR).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began to progress three years after the initial aortic valve-sparing replacement when mild AR was noted. Mild shortness of breath with exertion started four years postoperatively, evolving into moderate-to-severe AR by November 1999, approximately 6 1/3 years postoperatively. Reoperation was recommended due to increasing shortness of breath.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of an uncharacterized aortic disorder resulting in the sudden deaths of her mother, sister, grandfather, and great-grandfather.
